abstract: National Highway Traffic Safety Administration is investigating reopening of its inquiry into safety of some 2.7 million older Jeep sport utility vehicles, made by Chrysler; earlier investigation found Jeeps were prone to explode when hit in rear, where gas tanks were located; Fiat Chrysler Automobiles, which now owns Chrysler, recalled some affected models in 2009 but $150 million March verdict against automaker has reopened safety concerns and could spur more litigation.
lead_paragraph: Regulators are considering whether to reopen an investigation into Jeeps with rear gas tanks, despite Fiat Chrysler’s agreement two years ago to recall some of the affected models.

headline.main: Concerns on Jeep Safety Remain, Despite Recall
headline.print_headline: Concerns on Jeep Safety Remain, Despite Recall
